Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Indy (Big Ten Tourny)”
Reviews.Author: craigorie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located for thos who like to walk. I went to all the sites from here and not once did I catch a cab. The hotel was nice, cleaning staff was excellant, the day time and afternoon front desk staff was efficient and friendly , handled the high volume of traffic very well. The night time staff was unaware or did not care that I was in the lobby so they condocted business as usual, the older lady (3/9) behind the counter was short with costumers on the phone and after she hung up, she made disparaging comments about the callers to her coworker, that were totally inappropiate. She shuld not be working in customer service, give her a job behind the scene. The room was very nice and the City was very enjoyable, The War Memorial is a must see. Also you must visit the NCAA Hall of Fame. Plenty of affordable resaturants in the area, Mall was a block away. Great Place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: kellyd13
Reviews.Content: Smaller hotel located right by field house and stadium. Excellent customer service at front desk, in housekeeping and especially breakfast area. Regina and Janice ran a wonderful breakfast and started my day with a smile. Regina's wonderful attitude is contagious! We have stayed here for the last 5 years for the big 10 tournament and love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Convenient DT Location”
Reviews.Author: EngineersWife
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here during the Big Ten Playoffs. The king-bedded room we reserved on the Hilton Honors website was not available but the manager upgraded us to a king suite. Nice large room with microwave, refrigerator and big bathroom with jetted tub and small shower stall. Small sink area, but room to set travel bag. Easy to use thermostat that allowed us to set room to 60 degrees (we like to sleep in a cool room.) Worked well, except twice it seemed to reset itself to 75 degrees and the heat kicked on. As with all Hilton properties, the bed was very comfortable. We asked for extra pillows at check-in, and they were in our room when we returned from the games. Our room had three large windows with sheers and side panels. A previous review mentioned the inability to close the curtains to keep out the light. Our windows had blackout curtains that did an excellent job of darkening the room. Our room was pretty close to the ice machine and elevators, but it was very quiet. $17 valet parking was convenient. We called to get the car on our way out of our room and it was there by the time we checked out. Valets were very nice, asking if we needed directions. Breakfast room on second floor was very large and clean. Typical Hampton breakfast, but the hostess was very friendly and kept everything neat and well stocked. Everyone was very pleasant and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good deal”
Reviews.Author: DT808
Reviews.Content: I stay here annually during the NFL Combine. While you have to walk across the street a block to get to the sheltered walkway to get to the convention center, I find the location to be convenient and priced well, particularly when considering the free breakfast daily. 2 other benefits that you may not know - show your room card across the street at Hard Rock and receive a 20% discount, and they also give you a coupon for a discount on Indy Go, the airport shuttle bus that normally cost only $7. Finally, they have got to have the most friendly and helpful front desk staff when checking in. Checked out at 4 a.m. and the front desk wasn't as friendly, but I'll give someone a pass who has to work those hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Dragontail281
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Motorcycle Industry Dealer Expo. The Convention Center was only a 10 minute walk away and the main "night life" part of town was a block away. The hotel is right on Meridian, so it would be a great place to stay MotoGP weekend. Free breakfast & Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Love Hilton Hotels - now this Hampton too”
Reviews.Author: ABCMom21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Indianapolis and it's area more times then I can count. Since we get Hilton points we usually pick one of their hotels, but this is the first time we have stayed at this Hampton. We chose it because it gives a great military discount and it was in the heart of downtown - you can walk to so many things. Circle Center Mall is just a block away - but sadly we found there are few great shops left there. Better to stop at Hamilton Town Center or Keystone.There are lots of wonderful restaurants within a block or two of the Hampton. We found a gem in the Pearl Street Pizzaria - it's down an alleyway and if you are looking for a good beer selection you should check it out. The Hampton parking valet service was much better then other downtown Indy hotels. It was easy to turn into and we were met promptly. Cost is $17. Read reviews on this site and so asked for a room on a high level and at the end of the hallway - good advice! Only noise problem we had was the heater. Each room has it's own control so you can set it to the temp you like - it is loud when it starts up so be sure to set the bedtime temp for a low sleeping degree. One odd thing - the pillows are square shaped - but found them very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Mister Al”
Reviews.Author: Alan H
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at The Hampton - my room was large and affordable, the staff were great and friendly to me and when I had a problem (I thought I'd thrown away an important document in the garbage by mistake) they clicked into overdrive to help me find it, which I was super-impressed with and super-grateful for. I'll definitely go back there again. Plus there was an ATM less than 100 yards away. Coolio!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Wait”
Reviews.Author: Jackie B
Reviews.Content: It was clean, and the breakfast was good. Every-time someone slammed a door on my floor, my whole room shook. I couldn't shut the curtains on the window at all (and there was a superbowl party right beneath it). The drunk people speaking in the hall way around the corner I could clearly hear in my room at 3am. Went to leave, called in to get the valet car and 20 min later it still isn't there. 20 more min and its not there. My husband went to the valet desk and it had been there for a bit, they just hadn't gotten around to calling our name.....WHAT? 45 min wait for my car in a room with screaming children and you can't call out a name? *sigh*

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, reasonably priced !”
Reviews.Author: SunSeekerRon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location for one night with a co-worker, two weeks before the Superbowl in Indianapolis. This hotel was easy to get to, centrally located, and reasonably priced. Valet parking at $17.00 was fair for this location, while I found the service fast and friendly. Hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating, while my room was clean, with a spacious bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet with an ice machine on each floor. I enjoyed the small, but adequate fitness center, which consisted of three treadmills, a bike and a cross trainer, along with some weights. The hot breakfast in the morning was certainly better then most, including everything from fresh fruit to prepared omlettes and sausage paddies. The breakfast room was spacious, updated and comfortable. Overall, this hotel has a lot going for it with it's great central location, friendly staff, clean rooms, great breakfast and even breakfast on the run for those in a hurry. I will definately stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great service and great location!”
Reviews.Author: hnewheels
Reviews.Content: We changed hotels during our stay in Indianapolis from a 4-star hotel to this Hampton Inn. This hotel beat out the 4-star hands down in every category possible - and was a lot better priced. This hotel is very conveniently located downtown - close to everything! We were here for an event at the convention center and it's a very easy walk down the street. The staff (thank you Megan!) was over-the-top helpful. The rooms were nice and clean. The bathroom was good-sized. There are mirrors in the room so that more than one person can get ready at a time in the morning (always a bonus in our family). And best of all, it was quiet! The beds are double, not queen - so on the smaller side. There is a table and two chairs instead of a desk, which is nice for eating takeout or playing games. But the outlets are next to the table for computer usage. There is no refrigerator or microwave in the rooms. They do have a good variety of tv stations and pay movies available. The breakfast is free and is what I would call a continental-plus. There are some hot dishes available as well as the basics - and it's managed by some very sweet ladies who are very attentive. Also, the breakfast room is on the 2nd floor in a very large room with lots of space to move around in. A nice change from the usual squeeze-and-eat of most hotels with free continental breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: Ali B
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at the Hampton Inn Indianapolis Downtown. We were visiting Indianapolis just for the weekend and looking for a centrally located hotel so that it was walking distance to all of the experiences to be had in downtown Indianapolis. We definitely found it! The customer service was great- front desk service was friendly and helpful as well as the valet service (so convenient)! Their complimentary breakfast was fantastic as well- had a variety of breakfast items. We enjoyed our time so much, no doubt we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: INDYDANNYT
Reviews.Content: The staff there was wonderful as well as extremely clean . Went as far as sending up toothpaste AT 11:00 PM Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “very central”
Reviews.Author: cumbo
Reviews.Content: It's a great location in the middle of the city. Our room was very nice and at the rear so we had no traffic noise. It's an older style but still very comfortable, clean and roomy. It's an easy walk to the large shopping mall on the next block and there is a great Italian restaurant in there. You may park in the street but we used the valet parking which is next to the hotel. very nice breakfast and friendly staff also.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: addabeach
Reviews.Content: It was a very comfortable and centrally located hotel. Enjoyed the nice breakfast every morning and I think her name was Regina that seems to run the kitchen was extreme friendly and gave me some great tips on things to do and places to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location quiet property”
Reviews.Author: ndpete
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night. Check in staff very personable and relaxing check in. Room was typical Hampton Inn. Clean and comfortable. Rooms were smaller, its an older property but its well maintained. Breakfast was good. Staff at breakfast was great. Only negative is parking. Its a downtown property. Valet was $15 overnight...well worth it, since it was raining hard when we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Noisy Floor”
Reviews.Author: Hobietim
Reviews.Content: Nice HI, generous sized Breakfast area on second floor, very attentiuve generous number of staff. Do not allow yourself to be in the 1-10 series of rooms on any floor, they are near the elevators and VERY noisy. overall a decent classic HI experience.

Reviews.Title: “This Hampton is a great business and pleasure hotel”
Reviews.Author: ltdan_o
Reviews.Content: Just spent five nights at the Hampton Downtown Indianapolis on a business trip. This is a great place located right in the middle of downtown with nearly all attractions within walking distance. If you are a business traveler, you could not ask for a better hotel. I stayed in a regular room with a king bed. The room was small but plenty big enough for one person. The free business center was as good as any I have seen. The breakfast was always great. All staff members were extrememly helpfull and all but one was friendly (one of the valet parkers seemed to have an attitude). The building is very old, but Hampton did a good job creating a modern hotel out of the antique building. There are only two negatives that I can come up with: First, the parking is valet only and costs $15 a day so adds to the expense. Second, I had to literally run the water in the shower for 20 minutes to get hot water. Other people who stayed there told me their water was hot almost instantly, so maybe it was just my side of the hotel. There was actually a sign in the bathroom that stated to let the water run for several minutes for hot water. There is no pool and the workout room is limited, but I would not really call those negatives. Do not hesitate to stay at this hotel. Unless you are really picky, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “dont leave any money in your car when they park it for you”
Reviews.Author: ptgandsons
Reviews.Content: I have styed there for 6 0r 7 times in the past 2 years. I like the hotel,But the last 2 times I have been ripped off. I always give the guys a tip when they park the car and when they get it for me in the morning.I always keep alot of change in my car for parking and the grand kids. This time and the last time I have been taken for what ever change is in the holder except for the nickels and pennies.I have to stay there 3 more times this year and I see Buckingham has me going there 6 times next year. I dont think so. It a shame. I dont make alot and I am not cheap Becuse I know these guys need tips tomake a living. But Its too bad. And F F A was there and they ran the halls till after midnight not a good trip

Reviews.Title: “A perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: Billyma
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Indy was fantastic! The rooms and staff were great. The lobby of the hotel was beautiful. Right next to the mall which is connected to the convention center by a skywalk. The only problem they couldn't fix for us was the rain!

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: 7tocs7
Reviews.Content: I found there were good and not so good aspects to my stay / the hotel. The Good: The hotel is located in an area close to everything. If you like being in the middle of the action then consider booking here. The free breakfast is a bonus, although you may run into a full dining area and warm (as opposed to hot) food. The building itself is historic, I like that. I pre-requested a mini fridge and got one. The bathroom was a good size. Staff was pleasant. The Not so Good: My room had a view of a brick wall / alley. Not the fault of Hampton, they can't control the buildings that are built around them. I assume a lot of the views aren't great at this location. My room was sort of small, but not too bad. The wireless internet went in and out for awhile, they fixed the problem but it was a pain. Too bad they didn't knock $10 or so off the bill because of it (I mentioned the problem a couple of times). My room had some noise issues - minor though, just someone either in the room beside me or above me slamming a door. Also, if you don't need / want to be in the middle of all the action then consider something on the outskirts of downtown. I'd recommend this hotel if you first eliminated some of the other downtown hotels - usually they're priced much higher making the HI a good deal. This hotel had good bang for the buck when I booked it but if I was returning to downtown Indy I'd consider other options but I'd also be willing to stay here again if the price was right. So overall, I guess I'd say it was okay or fine. I wasn't blown away or anything but it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: My fiancee stayed here for his bachelor party. He used his card to hold the room and in the morning his groomsmen gave him cash to pay. He paid, thinking nothing about it. Later he discovered they had charged his debit card also. So he called the hotel and talked to Simon the manager. The manager said he would ask the clerk if he remembered the transaction. Of course the clerk didn't remember and Simon said there was nothing else to do he would just be out that money. REALLY??? Could he not check the books and see if they were over $122????? Our wedding is coming up in 9 days and we could have used that money. Now we are just out $122 because of his laziness of not getting to the bottom of it. I'm very disappointed!!! Keep your receipt if you stay here because they will steal your money if they can!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location ,staff, and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Ron A
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for three Big Ten Basketball tournaments and have loved our stay. The location is ideal (only one block to Conseco Arena).The staff at the front desk and breakfast staff are terrific and do their best to accomadate your every wish. This year we were forced to check out early because our son had to have emergency heart surgery and the staff was very helpful and sympathetic.Also one of the young men at the door ran almost two blocks to flag down an airport bus. We were not able to tip him,but called a friend and she gave him a tip which he was reluctant to take-Said he was just doing his job. Looking forward to our trip and stay in 2012.We also love meeting and interacting with fans from other Big Ten Universities.cannot not mention the breakfast and staff who work there. They are so helpful and energetic and hard working. I could say more good things ,but better stop. You get the idea.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel with some nice touches from the past”
Reviews.Author: MHKtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night midweek in September 2011. The hotel is nicely located downtown and convenient for my needs in Indianapolis. The hotel is in a historic old building and despite the refurbishing there are some nice touches showing the oldstyle granduer of the place/historic building that shine through (look for old brass fixtures including at elevators, the mail chute running through the floors, etc). I like when the architects keep some of the old fixtures when updating things. The room I was assigned (a 27 at end of hallway) was a suite with two flat screen TVs and separate bedroom / office living area. It was impeccably clean and well appointed. The tub peeling caulking and fixtures in bathtub were the only thing in the room I could find that seemed stale or a bit worn. Otherwise, I would say this hotel gives you everything you'd expect and then lots more from a Hampton Inn. A special note is reserved for the staff: The staff were exceptionally friendly (especially the breakfast ladies who go out of their way to help and provide advice and directions around town, even offering to print my boarding pass!).

Reviews.Title: “HOME BASE FOR MOTO GP”
Reviews.Author: Robear1954
Reviews.Content: This was the 4th time we have spent the GP weekend at the Hampton. Classic older building right in the middle of things. Completely modern, clean & comfortable rooms. Great breakfast, valet parking without a hitch, all employees were very friendly & most helpful. Needed a last minute room change after check-in, no problem, immediately provided us with another in 5 minutes. This was done for us by Joy from the front desk, & she was just that, a joy to deal with, whitty, fun & personable. Made our stay just a little more enjoyable. We'll be back next year for sure! Bob & Cliff

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, can't beat location.”
Reviews.Author: Aprilia_Motogp
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here over the weekend for the MotoGP races. Good rates, clean, large rooms. Only negative thing I had is that the hallways are not airconditioned. Otherwise, their free breakfast was great, and their dining area was large with many tables. Plenty of hot water, cheap parking (for motorcycles anyhow) and friendly staff. When I asked for a rollout sleeper, they waived the $25 fee since I was a Hilton Honors member....I'll be back for sure next year! Free Wifi worked great too!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Lovely, older but updated and well maintained!”
Reviews.Author: sassytoothfairy
Reviews.Content: Another great experience at the Hampton. This one books fast for events so I would recommend reservations. Clean rooms. Great comfortable beds and clean linnens. Rugs very clean. This Hampton is well maintained. Parking downtown is in parking garage. The city never sleeps. Great local, restaurants and mall within walking distance. It's better to walk to get around. Stayed here for college interview for child. Urban setting. Doorman, bags unloaded at curbside with bellman. White glove treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location-Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: hoteldiva05
Reviews.Content: I travel here for business very frequently. Great stay and courteous staff. Complimentary breakfast is great! Never had an issue that wasn't resolved quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Marcay
Reviews.Content: The front desk was not very friendly or helpful. I have usually had nice experiences with Hampton Inns not so withy this one. The toliet did not flush correctly and no one seem to care. Asking for an extra time to check out was not very successful and I am an Honorers member. Would not recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “really great service”
Reviews.Author: k325
Reviews.Content: we checked in on Friday afternoon at 4:00 PM the service was great. the breakfast was wonderful and the room was perfect I will be back. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: baseballmom732
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a baseball tournament and this was the hotel selected buy the tournament organizers. If I had a choice this is probably not where I would have stayed unless if was just me and my husband. This is a beautiful historcial building in a great downtown location. The view from out winfow was Nordstrom and the Hard Rock. There is a lot to do within very close walking distance and downtown Indianapolis is beautiful. There is no swimming pool at this hotel althoug there is one availabe nearby. There is no parking so valet service is required. Thankfully it was figured into our group rate which was good because it is $15 per day. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the bed was comfy and the room was clean. The standard double room is out of the question. At 5'10" I am the shortest member of my family and a double bed it out of the question. We have a very large room with high ceilings and a sleeper sofa. We were right by the elevator so it was loud in the morning but I am a early riser so it was no big deal. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 39Alive
Reviews.Content: Just between cOnseco fieldhouse, circle center and hard rock. Friendly staff. Has shuttle upon request to IU hospital

Reviews.Title: “Downtown deserves better...”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneManhattan
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat excited about staying at this building full of architectural history, figuring it would make for a unique stay. The room was larger than most in old buildings, as was the bathroom, however it was very noisy. I heard the "neighbors" across the hall with their kids as if they were in my room, and the room door rattled it seemed everytime someone walked by or shut a door across the hall. The hotel staff was not as friendly as I come to expect from Hilton properties. The lobby and free breakfast areas were large (if you have a big group), but was mostly empty during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: trswartz
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed recently at the Hampton Inn Downtown Indianapolis. I did my research and looked for a place that had received good reviews from previous customers. Out of all the hotels in downtown Indy, Hampton Inn seemed to garner the most positive reviews from people. Well I have to say that our experience at this hotel was absolutely fantastic. The staff, especially the front desk clerks, were friendly and helpful; the rooms were clean and nice, and the free hot breakfast provided every morning was top notch. The women who worked in the hot breakfast area were so nice, it was always a pleasure to talk with them in the morning. The Hampton provides Valet parking at $15 a day, which is cheaper than most other places nearby. I know that this is the place we will stay for any future trips to Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: kyhoneybluegrass
Reviews.Content: Just got back from your hotel for the Dealer Expo. This is the second year we've stayed at the Hampton Inn Indy Downtown. We love this hotel! The staff is wonderful, so very friendly; the front desk staff, valet and breakfast attendants are friendly and helpful. This year we were upgraded to a suite with a jacuzzi. That was a nice treat for us as we are hardly ever able to get away for a weekend. I can't wait for next year's Dealer Expo and our night at the Hampton Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Indianapolis Secret”
Reviews.Author: Debby5480
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise to find such a clean, friendly hotel in the fun city of Indianapolis. The Hanpton is a great location near shopping, sites, entertainment, restaurants ,and sports venues. From the valet parking to the breakfast staff staying here makes you enjoy the city even more.This is a converted turn of the century railway ofifce building. The Hilton Family did an outstanding job of creating roomy bath & bedrooms. We booked the SHOP & DROP package to use at Circle Centre Mall which is right across the street. This pkg was worth the money.Pacers basketball is less than a 3 minute walk. How convienent for all NCAA and PRO basketball fans. Used the clean fitness center which provided towel, water, earphones, and clean TV equipment. We highly recommend this Hampton in the historic railway building. This is my choice for hotel my next Indy visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: billiesan
Reviews.Content: Every year we stay at this hotel for Gencon and every year we have a fantastic time. The hotel rooms are always very clean and comfortable. The hotel staff is always extremely friendly and helpful. They show appreciation for our business and that makes us feel very welcome. The parking attendants are always great. They take care of our car, help us with our bags and give us directions with a smile every time. The lounge and breakfast is always terriffic! Coffee in the lounge is always available for free at all times during the day or night. The lounge is one of my favorite parts of this hotel. The location of this hotel is right downtown so everything is within walking distance. I am never concerned with security at this hotel since you need your keycard to get into the hotel and elevators at night. I love this hotel and I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Indy. This is probably the most comfortable I have ever been in a hotel. I hope this hotel never changes!

Reviews.Title: “Great Indy Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lee_nyc_82
Reviews.Content: Just made a trip to Indianapolis from New York and loved the city. I stayed at the Hampton Inn and all the staff made my stay feel really comfortable. From my check-in to check-out, they really made me feel that Midwest hospitality. I especially enjoyed the free breakfast for the two days I was at the hotel. …Didn’t hurt that the hotel is located across the street from the downtown mall. All in all, great stay and would pick it again once I travel back.

Reviews.Title: “They don't care about their customers.”
Reviews.Author: melhoutz
Reviews.Content: I am a Gold VIP member of the Hilton Honors program. I travel about 40 nights a year for my job so when my son and his friend needed to attend a conference for college in Indianapolis I booked them at this Hampton Inn. Because it's downtown you have to pay for Valet Parking ($14.00/night) which was fine. But apparently at 2:30 am some "unknown" person "illegally" parked in their secure valet garage and backed into my son's car causing over $1000 worth of damage to the driver's side fender and door. You had to really pull hard to even get the driver's door to open so he could get into it and get home. This car is his only means of transportation, his college is 2.5 hours from home and 5.5 hours from Indy. The hotel filed a police report and called my son's phone and left him a message that there had been an incident. Initially they sounded like they would make sure the repairs were taken care. However, once my son left the facility (and was still charged the $14 parking fee) it was nearly impossible to get someone to call us back to try and make arrangements for the repairs. After several attemps I finally reached the manager and he said that if I faxed over the estimate from the body shop that he would have us taken care of by their insurance and they would work on getting reimbursed by this "third party"...a week went by and I didn't hear anything. Then I get a call from their insurance agent and she was extremely rude, condescending and basically called me a liar because they had no intention of paying for the repairs and didn't know why the manager would tell me that!!! I have no information on who this other "third party" is - no insurance information from them or a name, nothing. The insurance agent said I would just have to report it to my own insurance (causing my rates to go up for having a claim) or call the police department to see if I could find any information on this other person. I was furious!!! I have attempted to reach the hotel manager again but of course he won't respond to emails or phone calls so I want to spread the word about what they have (or in this case haven't) done and I also let the corporate offices know that Hilton hotels will no longer be my choice of accomodations when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: msu_mom
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 3 or 4 times. The location is great if you are doing something in downtown Indy, the Lucas Oil Stadium is a short walk away. Valet parking is $14 a day, not too bad for a downtown area. Staff is very friendly and helpful especially the breakfast staff. Rooms vary a lot in size but all are adequate. The shower wasn't great, water pressure was a bit weak and the shower head was mounted way too high, about 8 feet up.

Reviews.Title: “In the center of it all in the Circle City!”
Reviews.Author: JennandRob
Reviews.Content: My husband and toddler just came back from our weekend stay and had a spectacular time! The location can't be beat - really. Steps from shopping, restaurants, Consact teco Fieldhouse, Lucas Oil Stadium, Bars & other awesome tourist attractions. You don't need a car at all!! Room was ready early. Beds were super comfortable, and breakfast was quite tasty! I appreciate the fact that they changed the food around on our second day...simply for variety sake! Staff was really pleasant - especially the ladies in the breakfast room. Overall, you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Crusty, Oldy Moldy”
Reviews.Author: kikiroo
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that I usually love Hampton Inns. They are consistently clean, bright, and comfortable. That's why I am so disappointed in this property. It is dark, dank and dirty. There are some positives: It's in a great location, within walking distance to tons of restaurants, shopping, and downtown city sites. The front desk staff was super-friendly and very helpful. But the negatives far outnumber the good things. The lobby is definitely not a place you'd want to hang out. Think old bad 80s tile and lots of stained and worn out laminate. This along with the elevators gives the whole public space area a sort of hospital or industrial vibe. The rooms are very sub-par for a Hampton Inn. The ventilation system was so loud I felt like I was in an airplane hangar and I actually had to turn it off to even hear the television. The bathrooms are in dire need of an update, again with 80s icky beige tile with gray grout that just looks old and dirty. And even though I was in a non-smoking room I swear I smelled smoke. Not fresh smoke, but maybe smoke from 20 previous years of smoking. Or mold in the vents. Ick. Dust on all of the switch and outlet plates. Thin, sorry towels. Just bad in general. Maybe I wouldn't be so harsh in my review if I weren't comparing this property to all of the other Hampton Inns I've stayed at in my life. But they have all been so nice! I am shocked that Hilton allows this hotel to be remain a Hampton Inn. If I hadn't been part of a group block I would have hightailed it out of there at first sight. It wasn't cheap either, which makes it all the more disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Just Majestic”
Reviews.Author: atoril
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a good place to choose in Indianapolis. Visited 3 times and always service was very good. Valet parking is available. Internet connection is free and extremely fast. Since it is right in the middle of downtown, the night life is also easy. The breakfast menu is good. Also have eatout breakfast also.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: creamslacks
Reviews.Content: very average hotel with a good downtown location. could do with a renovation soon - but clean and a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location - No Frills”
Reviews.Author: DT808
Reviews.Content: Rate was lower than the more upscale chains. Free hot breakfast was a plus. Also, so was 24 hours free access to computers and printers. Lobby area is not as nice as other hotels and front desk staff appeared helpful at times. Very convenient to convention center, centre mall, and conseco fieldhouse. Downside is that the other upscale hotels have indoor skyways to convention center, but for this hotel, you need to walk outside until you hit centre mall across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreeleyInd
Reviews.Content: I love this place. The parking has gotten expensive but it is rare to find a place right in the heart of a major city under $100. The breakfast of buscuits and gravy, bacon/egg bagels, coffee, fruit, cereal, etc is free and terrific. The front desk gals are fun and friendly at all times of day and night. This is just the best place on a budget. The rooms were very nice and the bed extremely comfortable. Everybody seems to love their jobs, including the sparkling lady who is in charge of the breakfast. They make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Perfect stay downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: lala1202
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and it's staff! I will stay here again for my next Indy trip! I must say the breakfast area was better than expected and kept us from paying to eat breakfast out! When a staff member found out that I couldnt sleep without the noise from my fan ( like at home) she made sure a fan was placed in my room that day while I was away! (Thanks so much!) While downtown take advantage of the $5 cabs to any other downtown location! Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Not the Normal Hampton Quality”
Reviews.Author: SmoothFlyer
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and two of our friends stayed at the Hampton Inn downtown on a Saturday night for a wedding that was downtown Indy. We had a suite which consisted of a bedroom with a king bed and a living room area with a full size pull out sofa sleeper. The hotel itself wasn’t that bad. But this Hampton Inn did lack many of the "clean" qualities that I usually enjoy when I stay at other Hampton Inns when traveling for work. The carpet in the rooms had a very circa 1970s greenish color that felt gross to walk on. The bathroom looked like it was from 1985 and was kind of gross. The tub looked like it hadn't been cleaned prior to our arrival. The most annoying part of the room was the window blinds that did not fully cover the window. The windows did have a very light cloth material over them that, I guess, were suppose to be the blinds. But they did nothing for the morning sun. At about 7:30 Sunday morning, the bedroom felt like we were sleeping in under the sun in the middle of the day. After a night of partying at the wedding, all we wanted to do was sleep in. The Good... The suite did have two 32 inch flat screen TVs and had a working AC which was nice. The breakfast was decent for a hotel and the valet parking was very convenient. The staff was pleasant and was able to let us do an early check in and valet park prior to 3:00. Would I stay there again? Maybe, if the price was right and I wasn’t looking for a romantic type stay. I probably would check out other downtown hotels first though.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hampton Inn, but in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: korokoro
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to say - the usual Hampton Inn quality and service. Nothing exceptional (although the staff friendly if not terribly well organised). The rooms are small but very comfortable. Free internet of course and free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Charlville
Reviews.Content: Not up to normal Hampton Inn standards. We had a King room with hot tub (didn't use due to hair in it!) Room quite rundown and tatty, bathroom not very clean and dark, accessories hanging off the wall Door lock issues, air con very noisy and uncontrollable. Valet forgot to bring our car around on check out. Not the friendliest front desk on check in.

Reviews.Title: “parking valet”
Reviews.Author: niecy1st
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was nice, clean, and comfortable. I don't know if the air in the halls and elevators were on the blink, but it was hot and muggy the entire time. My beef was with the parking valet on the last day, change had been taken out of the car, it wasn't much, but the fact that it was taken. I did not make a fuss about it, we just went our merry way, might as well took it all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you're going to Conseco Fieldhouse”
Reviews.Author: Rubyshopaholic
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at this downtown Hampton to attend an event at Conseco Fieldhouse. We found the hotel to be very clean, the staff very friendly and the hot /cold breakfast full of choices. It was a great experience and within walking distance to just about anything. Valet parking was reasonable at $14.00/day. Would definately reccomend this hotel to anyone needing downtown accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: purplevegas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Downtown for a weekend trip to Indianapolis. The hotel is located right across from Circle Centre Mall and within walking distance to Monument Circle and several restaurants and bars, so no car is needed unless you're leaving the downtown area. Conseco Fieldhouse and Lucas Oil Stadium are also very convenient to the hotel. The room was clean, although a little small with a king-sized bed in it. Throughout my stay, I had no issues with anything in the room. The bathroom was clean and the shower had great water pressure, so I was happy. The valet is $14 a day and there are no options for self-parking at this hotel. However, I found the cost to be a non-issue because the valet staff is incredibly nice and didn't even complain when I needed my car at 1AM! The hotel staff was incredibly nice to me whenever I encountered them. At one point, I had an issue with my key not working and they resolved this immediately. This hotel is very accessible to both I-65 and I-70 out of downtown, so the location cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff; too much street noise”
Reviews.Author: Carpinteria
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't be better -- near to everything in downtown, it seems. Moreover, the staff were friendly, courteous, and BOUNTIFUL (a refreshing find in any U.S. lodging, especially a budget one). EVERYONE I encountered was helpful, courteous, informative, and seemed genuinely delighted that I was a guest in the property. Unfortunately, however, the noise from the busy streets below kept me from sleeping (though when I asked at the desk if I might be moved to a quieter room I was told that "historic" usually also meant "noisy," and that they would provide some earplugs, if I desired. One of the reasons I stayed at this property was because of its "historic" description, which is extremely misleading, as what was probably once a charming building was apparently gutted and outfitted as inexpensively as possible. However, the location was good (splendid restaurants nearby), and the staff are exceptionally pleasant and helpful, as noted below. Yet, I won't again stay at this hotel, because though they've strapped on some new windows to the old ones, whatever they've done in an effort to soundproof this property fails - miserably (just like my attempts to sleep the night I stayed there).

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn...just o.k.”
Reviews.Author: mrem
Reviews.Content: I arrived late in the evening and the staff ws very friendly. I got to my room and the air conditioning would not turn on (it was hot there that week) and in addition the TV remote did not work. I went down to the desk twice to try to resolve the TV and air conditioning. A staff person was very kind and worked on both via telephone with a maintenance person. I noticed near the bed, door, and lampshade were these red beetle looking bugs. I also found one or two in the bed. I went to bed and kept waking up with something crawling on me...it was those red bugs! By now I am sure they thought I was nuts, but I could not sleep there, so I called down to the desk at 12:30am and asked about the bugs. Without hesitation they moved me to another room. But I guess I was discussed by the front desk. It seemed when I went to the front desk they already knew about the lady with the bug problem. I liked the smaller room they put me in, but the TV remote did not work in there either and sometimes the TV would just switch channels while I was watching.. I did not dare complain...since I the ordeal with the bugs. The business center has one computer and their connection is slow. The fitness center had an assortment of old equipment, but two nice treadmills. The breakfast was good and dining area had a nice view of the corner. The location is great. But where are the Hampton Inn cookies? They did not serve cookies in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: familyvacationIN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Downtown for our 7th wedding anniversary. We got the Wine and Dine package. We had a whirlpool king suite, valet parking, and a $100 gift cert for Ruth Chris's Steakhouse. It was great. The mall and steakhouse were in walking distance. The hotel was elegant and classy. Our room had high ceilings, more like a NY studio apartment and a HUGE whirlpool garden tub with separate shower and toilet. The breakfast was nice, dining room was very nice. The comforter on the bed was very nice. I was very satisfied with the package we got.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer07
Reviews.Content: We just had my bachelorette party in Indy, and I suggested my Mother stay here. (I spent a lot of time there with her at the hotel). The staff was increadibly friendly and helpful and her rooms were nice, the beds were very comfortable, and it was reasonably priced. You also can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, very clean, great staff”
Reviews.Author: SMcBaker
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here. Staff was wonderful, very helpful, very accomodating. The room was absolutely, perfectly clean, especially the bathroom. Comfortable beds. Breakfast in the morning was very good, plenty of selection and plenty of seating. Valet parking was efficient. Walking distance to everything downtown. Great stay, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luvvegas1198
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for visiting Indy. The only problem we had was the panhandlers on the street as you walk. The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly. The valet parking guys were very fast if you needed your car. This is next to the circle center mall and lots of restuarants. Try the Weber Grill.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay and a great value”
Reviews.Author: Michele_Pope
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four nights for business. I came in very late and was given a room upgrade which was greatly appreciated. The suite looked like it had at one time been (or still was) a handicapped accessible room. Strange though that it was at the extreme (and I mean extreme) end of the property away from the elevator. The room was very nice and clean. The bed very comfortable and despite being right across from a music club, I slept very well. I appreciated the free internet service and the free business center services (computer & printing). The bad news: I had to clean someone else's toe nail clippings from the carpet before I could really feel comfortable, the lobby REEKED of old cigarette smoke and I suspect there are rats about in the building. I left at 3:30 am and two rooms had left their garbage outside their doors. It was ripped apart like, well....like a rat or two had been on the prowl. I guess this is to be expected being that it is an old building. Overall, the location was awesome, the staff very friendly and I felt safe and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, boring stay for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: KazariKid
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a boring place to stay, and cheap, for a meeting in Indianapolis. This Hampton Inn fit the bill. It had free breakfast and a business center. It had valets and bag storage. It had helpful staff to get me to a nice gift store. In summary, for $109, it was a reasonably-priced stay. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for stay in downtown Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: dnwilliams
Reviews.Content: Great location. Many restaurants within a block or two. Staff cheerful and helpful. Spacious Lobby and Breakfast area. Room comfortable, clean, and quiet. Would certainly stay hyere again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: CastleKnight
Reviews.Content: We, a family with teens stayed at this hotel over Thanksgiving weekend. Our main reason for the trip was to attend a Colts game and do some early Christmas shopping. We booked thru the Indy.org visitors site. We got a holiday shopping pkg. The room,free valet parking, and a $25 gift card to the mall for $159. The Indy.org site was cheaper than the Hampton website. I booked the Hampton Inn after reading all the positive reviews here. Our stay went smoothly. The room was clean and decorated nicely. The beds were comfy.The valet parking was very handy and one of the cheaper deals for valet.... $12 per day. The free BF was nice as well. We were on the 2nd floor the same floor as the BF room. The hotel located right across the street from Circle Center Mall and a vey short walk to the RCA Dome. For meals near rhe hotel we ate at The Spaghetti Factory located nearby and had a great affordable meal in a neat historic building.We also dined at Johnny Rockets in the mall. Way over priced and not that good of food for the price....wont do that again. Lots of restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. We will book the Hamton for all our future trips to Indy. Very satisfied with our stay. Deb-Indiana

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Katpaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on July 14-15. The front desk was friendly and helpful. Just a block from Circle Center Mall and some restaurants nearby. The complimentary breakfast was good and plenty to eat (buffet-had scambled eggs and other usual foods like cereal, muffins, and so on). We were on the 3rd floor. Only problems that we encountered were that you could hear the traffic from the street below and being a Friday night there was a lot. We adjusted the ac to cool the room and it didn't seem like the temperature changed at all. The room was a little on the small side but very clean. The beds were very comfortable. Bathroom had plenty of towels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location Hampton Inn has the best”
Reviews.Author: sweetiepie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into room 303 King study suite with whilpool tub. The room was very clean and the tub was nice and romantic. The staff was very nice and location is great. You can walk to anywhere in downtown. Tons of nightclubs but we never went anywhere other than slippery noodle blues club, and mall across the street. The breakfast was good and in a huge area. The only bad thing about the hotel is no pool. I would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place In Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here on our wedding night and it was fantastic! Perfect location downtown near lots of restaurants, shopping, and more! Skyhigh rooms gives a beautiful downview. Staff is very helpful, friendly, and curtious! Rooms are so clean! The FREE breakfast is awesome! So much free food (for a continental breaksfast) it seems like a buffet. There's definately something for everyone. We love this hotel so much that I took my wife back on our 1 year anniversary! Best hotel downtown!

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Indianapolis Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 105 S Meridian St, Indianapolis, IN 46225
